greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of forests on n unlabeled nodes with k edges (n>=1, 0<=k<=n-1).
reference: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Graphical Enumeration, Academic Press, NY, 1973, pp. 58-59.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
example: 1,1,2,4,6,6 <- T(6,3) = 4 forests on 6 nodes with 3 edges.
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = If[n <= 1, n, (Sum[Sum[d*b[d], {d, Divisors[j]}]*b[n-j], {j, 1, n-1}])/(n-1)]; t[n_] := If[n == 0, 1, b[n] - (Sum[b[k]*b[n-k], {k, 0, n}] - If[Mod[n, 2] == 0, b[n/2], 0])/2]; g[n_, i_] := g[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Expand[Sum[Binomial[t[i] + j - 1, j]*g[n - i*j, i-1]*x^j, {j, 0, n/i}]]]]; T[n_] := CoefficientList[g[n, n], x] // Reverse // Most; Table[T[n], {n, 1, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 16 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Row sums give A005195. Rightmost diagonal gives A000055. Cf. A001858, A138464.
Rows converge to A215930. Reflected table is A095133. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 11 2014
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 09 2008
